normalized: it seems like so long ago now that ithink about it.
i was living my life in the back of alleyways of the urban areas of a planet far from earth.
i had never known the faces or names ofmy parents.
or even my name.
of course, being born and raised there too.
i learned how to live in the back of thealleyways.
every day was a succession of betrayaland stealing.
living every day like a stray dog,i'd have tomorrow to live if i didn't die.
i didn't particularly mind that.
it's no wonder.
when a guy is born into hell,then he doesn't believe there is anythingother than hell.
and i was blessed with the most suitable"ability" for me to survive in that sortof environment.
no matter what kind of mess i got myselfinto, the ability always somehow got me out.
and then, with me living my life dependenton just "that", a turning point visited uponme one night.
i, who possessed nothing more than my own"turf", had happened upon the site ofsomething unknowingly.

name: man
normalized: hey, is this place safe to conduct ourbusiness?

name: man
normalized: yeah, i've set up a sniper just in case.
anee-san should be along shortly too
i could see from the shadows men dressed in suits coming and going hurriedly.
they were all holding small weapons intheir hands.
from the looks of it, they were about toconduct some major business here, whicheven i could easily guess as to what.
and then, the men brought out a largeattache case that they had placed under guard.
gulp
my greed came out.
there was something inside of that casethat i had to have.
they had something i never had living inthe alleyways my whole life.
i had no doubt that it surely must besomething magnificent.
i had no way of stopping the desire thatcame seething out of me at that moment.
thud!
a man stacked with muscles collapsed.
geez…you sure took your time
why were people who ate a meal every day so stubborn in losing consciousness like this…
i was envious too; i hungered for more.
you wouldn't mind if i borrowed you forjust a minute, would you?
while saying that to the man that hadcollapsed, i gazed at the body.
eyes, nose, mouth, ears.
right hand, left hand, thick ankles,shoe size.
i couldn't begin to guess his weight.
a lot of meat on those bones.
i imagined the type of voice he hadfrom the shape of his bulging adam's apple.
and then, i remembered all that at once.
i grew accustom to it after that.
snap!
crack!
strange noises, like thebreaking of a spinal column, resounded throughthe dank alleyways.
moreover, it was continuous.
it wasn't the man that had collapsed,but my entire body folding in on itself andtaking a new form all at once.
guu…oh, ohh…ahh!
with the slight pain, my cells groaned witha rapidly growing itch.
at the same time, my figure was continuingto change.
it was as if i was growing flesh on mybones like the man that was tumbled overthere now.
no, it was a copy of that man's physique.
after the last of the remarkably loud sounds,my flesh and skeleton had changed into somethingobviously different than before.
my face is next.
i guess i should hurry since there isn't muchtime until those dealings take place…
i concentrated on my conscious face whileremoving the watch from the man.
i was going to be the perfect disguiseof this man after this.
but it wasn't a disguise, it was ametamorphosis.
it was without a doubt the reason i wasable to survive in the alleyways.
it took about 10 seconds for the face.
and i was able to transform into any shapewithin a few minutes.
with the exception of becoming hungry andthe abnormalities associated with doing that,it was a very handy ability.
had i been endowed with such an abilityfor some reason…?
i had never thought much about it until now.
only that i used it because i could.
all i knew was that i was sure that itwas the reason i was alive.
and that was the extent that i trustedin that ability.
i also understood that it was no morethan a strange talent.
and so, slowly, my face changed as i toreoff the man's clothing.
i was becoming this man so that i couldsteal the attache case.
that was my plan.

name: cheerful woman
normalized: hmm, what an interesting discovery♪
guu!?
an aloof voice had called out the momentthe skin had melted and changed my face.

name: cheerful woman
normalized: now why would you be removing the clothesfrom a follower for?
you wouldn't mind telling onee-san what this is all about, i wonder?
without any strain in her lively voice,the lone woman entered the back alleyway.

name: cheerful woman
normalized: fufu…
she was young.
but, the smile that held much self-confidencedidn't correspond well to her age.
d, damn it…
being too preoccupied by copying theman's face, i hadn't noticed this woman.
i began panicking at once.
things were rapidly taking a turn for theworse.
the result was my mutated face in themidst of changing…
shit!
don't tell me that that this means i'm"out of time".
the strings of my concentration were cutand i wasn't able to maintain the face.
shit!
shit!
shit!
i had to mold my face quickly,but i couldn't.
i muddled my face impatiently…and thenit crumbled.
that woman was right there as i gazed ather through a narrow field of vision like myeyes had been sewn together.
with the bizarre spectacle unfolding beforeher eyes, i realized that her expressionstiffened up a little.
don't…look.
don't look…at me!

name: cheerful woman
normalized: ehh
gahh!

movee!

eh?

gehah!
and then, when i realized that i was flyingin the air after i had tried thrusting awayfrom her hand, my body smacked into the concrete.
my body did a somersault so that my backtook the brunt of the fall.

name: cheerful woman

you really flew, huh?
how does it feel to be a bird?
free and spacious, right?

a great interest…no, a great curiosity,like that of a child's…scrutinizing andstaring right at me.

am i not scary!?

i made an idiotic expression at her.

if you don't hold your handout to strangers in a rational way and if you do those sorts of things, then…

name: cheerful woman

she was asking me.

but, i was strangely not scared.
